parts.text: {"word":"stroke-affected","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"脳卒中の影響を受けた、脳卒中後遺症のある","english_definition":"Affected by a stroke; having residual effects from a stroke.","examples":[{"sentence":"The stroke-affected patient required extensive rehabilitation.","translation":"脳卒中の影響を受けた患者は、広範囲なリハビリテーションを必要とした。"},{"sentence":"Stroke-affected individuals may experience difficulty with speech and movement.","translation":"脳卒中後遺症のある人は、言語や運動に困難を経験することがある。"},{"sentence":"The study focused on improving the quality of life for stroke-affected people.","translation":"その研究は、脳卒中の影響を受けた人々の生活の質を向上させることに焦点を当てた。"}],"collocations":["stroke-affected patient","stroke-affected individual","stroke-affected population","stroke-affected side","stroke-affected arm/leg"],"synonyms":["post-stroke","stroke survivor (when referring to a person)"],"antonyms":["healthy","unaffected","non-stroke"],"related_words":["stroke","hemiplegia","aphasia","rehabilitation","therapy"],"level_frequency":{},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"The term \"stroke-affected\" is used to describe individuals who have experienced a stroke and are living with the resulting impairments.
